intro: Cotoneaster pyrenaicus, commonly known as the Pyrenean cotoneaster, is a species of shrub native to the Pyrenees Mountains. It is characterized by its dense, rounded growth habit and produces clusters of small, orange-red berries in the fall. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It is adapted to rocky and alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Cotoneaster pyrenaicus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate cold climates.
